intro: Ruschia oviformis, commonly known as the oval leaf Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or orange, typically during the summer months. Ruschia oviformis is well adapted to arid environments and is often grown as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
